reviewTitle: Do your research on this product before buying.
reviewDescription: First let me say that some people write bad reviews for their own wrong doings for ordering wrong product like this one  thinking it can do something that it cannot do. A lot of people state this is not a detector. Well of course it’s not. It states write in the details it is not. It is a ‘Listener’. Meaning it listens for your already installed detectors alarms. Now I have only battery detectors. Two of them. One on my first floor one in the basement.  Now they are battery and do not ‘talk’ to each other.  So if basement smoke detector goes off. It will not trigger the upstairs to alarm. So then I would need this product at every smoke detector!  So I removed it. I ordered ‘First Alert smoke/CO Z wave. So they directly go to ring Alarm system. I got them on google store from Costco. A 3 pack for $80. So if you have a hardwire ‘interconnected’ system now that you recently purchased your alarms.  Then I would say this product is awesome. You will only need one because with a hardwired ‘interconnected’ system if one goes off they all go off.  So no matter what detector you put it near Ring will get the alarm notification. So know what your system is now will help in your purchase. Also people state they have to rip the wall off to remove is a lie. When you unscrew the top after you ‘remove’ the device from your system then you see next to the battery there is a clip that you depress down and slide the listener off it’s bracket. Very easy.Hope this helps some people.

I accidentally triggered the fire dept to come to my house within minutes of installing this thing. Here’s what happened:1. I installed the device next to my smoke/CO detector per the instructions.2.  The instructions say to test the listener in the Ring app3. I go to do so, but end up accidentally going into the **wrong** test menu (turns out there are two different test menus, one just for base station connectivity and one to bypass monitoring, and they both say Test Listener)4. I press the test button on my actual smoke detector thinking my new Ring listener is just in test mode and won’t trigger the fire dept5. I get two separate immediate alerts from Ring monitoring that fire and CO respectively are detected in my house. And I dismiss them both within literally 2 seconds. No big deal I thought since I dismissed them quickly.6. Ring monitoring calls 30 seconds later. I tell them who I am and I just set it up and was just doing the testing (per instructions). They said, ‘oh well with CO we dispatch first and then call the home.’***SHOCK*** (That’s not how the Ring alarm monitoring usually works!) I asked if they can cancel the dispatch and they cannot.7. I try calling fire dept to cancel but no answer probably because they’re rushing to my house.8. So, fire engine with crew shows up with sirens and lights and horns, and I have to explain how this accident happened. I apologized profusely and fortunately the firefighter was cool about it, but not all departments will be like that, especially because this may cause them to miss another real emergency.TLDR; The instructions tell you to test the device in the ring app. There are two separate test menus for this listener in the Ring app. One disables monitoring and dispatching for 15 mins so you can test your detector, the other just tests the Ring listener’s connection to base station without disabling monitoring. They both say Test! Don’t mix them up! The one inside of Advanced Settings will not prevent Ring from dispatching the fire department immediately!

reviewTitle: Initially had problems, support was fantastic. Problems SOLVED!
reviewDescription: I bought this kit to replace my LifeShield system. When I ordered I got enough kit to replace sensor for sensor. All of the kit arrived and I started the process of setting it up. The base connected to my network without a hitch but I wasn't unable to get ANY of the other devices to connect to the base. I had keypads, contact sensors, motion sensors, water and fire sensors and NONE of them would connect. So I reached out to support via email. In hind sight I should have just called but I was hoping for a short, quick answer that would solve all of my problems. That didn't happen and I got pretty frustrated. After several hours over several days of finding other reports online and trying what they had tried I was ready to throw in the towel. Then Danielle contacted me. She put me in touch with Nick in tech support and he tried for over an hour with me to get something, anything to connect. He had me disconnect other stuff in my house that could be causing interference with no luck. Finally I gave up out of frustration. I really wanted this kit to work because I already have Ring cameras and wanted an all-in-one solution.I waited a couple of days for Danielle to get back to me. In the mean time I spent time here and there trying to see if I could get something to connect, but with no success. Until today. Today I literally shut off the power to every single thing in my house except for my internet connection gear and I started over. Base station came right up. Plugged in the keypad and it looked like it was going to fail like it always has, until it CONNECTED! Contact sensor? CONNECTED! Motion? Water? Fire? Other keypads? All CONNECTED!My existing alarm is from LifeShield. Turns out I had two repeaters I did not remember installing that were causing interference and preventing the sensors from communicating with the base. Once those were off I had no issues connecting up the rest of the kit.I still have not installed this as my active alarm but I will get that done soon. Bottom line is that my initial review and bad experience with this alarm were all caused by other kit in my house. The support I got from Ring, even when I wasn't kind, was great. For that they get 5 stars and I will come back and update this review once I have some experience with the system.

reviewTitle: Nice idea, buy buy a new First Alert Z-wave instead
reviewDescription: This was a good idea to tie in existing smoke/co devices but the execution makes it worthless.  The instructions say it needs to be 3-6" away and I found that it wouldn't work more than an arms length away and even then it needed to be pointed directly at the alarm.  This means you can't really use it with more than one alarm even though the FAQ suggests you could do it.  So why would anyone get this instead of just buying a brand new First Alert Z-wave combo alarm for the same money?  The only good reason is if you live somewhere you can't replace your alarm but even then it makes more sense to buy a new Z-wave and stick it somewhere so you have twice the protection.The setup of this device is surprisingly tricky.  You have to press a small button on the side to get it into test mode but while it lights up initially there's no indication you're in test mode.  I held it apparently for too long and it won't enter test mode.  The app doesn't give any indication of what should happen next but if you press it SHORT then it will go to the next screen to register any alarms.  The app won't let you "reset" the alarm so you can test multiple alarms of the same type - you have to repeat the whole test!  Finally even removing the alarm was tricky.  You have to time the clicking of remove in the app with removal & reinserting the batteries in some combination that didn't work the first two times and again there's no indication of what's supposed to be happening or what happens next.This listens for the 3 or 4 tones produced by devices in the last 10 years.  They should tell you it flashes red when it hears any loud sound - so you can see it flash for each beep by your Smoke/CO detector.  But I wanted to use my old alarm system which has smoke / heat detectors which don't have a siren built-in and rely upon the system to alert the user.  That system makes a continuous on/off siren and was not identified as T3 or T4 so it didn't detect it.  There should be a way to hook alarm outputs directly to this thing so you can tie in an old alarm system or a fire sprinkler sensor.Overall I can't figure out what they were thinking.  It's overpriced vs the First Alert Z-wave combo alarm and won't let you use other sensors or your old alarm system.

reviewTitle: Smoke and CO monitoring is not available for business addresses.
reviewDescription: NOTE: RING ALARM SMOKE AND CO MONITORING IS NOT AVAILABLE FOR BUSNIESSES. INTENDED FOR RESIDENTIAL USE.It is not mentioned in the device details on the Amazon product page or in the setup instructions, but this cannot not be used at a business address!Reviewed Ring Alarm Smoke and CO Listener product on Amazon website and placed a purchase. Received the device and attempted to link it to Ring Alarm system used at local business. Device could not be connected with the provided step-by-step instructions. Check Ring support site and called Ring support, issue still could not be resolved.Was able to connect the device to the alarm system by selecting "Flood & Freeze Sensor". Once again, no mention of this on Amazon or Ring's product pages, in the device instructions, or during a phone conversation with Ring support.Cannot provide any opinion on the product itself, but there is a problem with product documentation and technical support.Email message received from Amazon after device setup:"Due to strict regulations, Ring cannot provide smoke and CO monitoring at business locations.Why can’t Ring provide smoke or carbon monoxide monitoring?If you use this device and smoke or CO is detected, Ring Alarm is required to send the smoke or CO signal to the monitoring center, and the monitoring center must request dispatch from local authorities. However, depending on your local laws, your local authorities may not show up, and you may incur serious penalties and/or large fines. To avoid these consequences, remove this smoke/CO monitoring device.What should I do?We are asking you to remove this device from your Ring Alarm. Adding and using a professionally monitored smoke or CO device to a Ring Alarm at your business violates our Terms of Service. If you do not remove this device, you are solely responsible for any fines, fees, or penalties that result from installing and using these devices on your business property."

reviewTitle: Decided to not use it (Updated Feb 8, 2020)
reviewDescription: I was looking forward to being able to use this because it would integrate with the interconnected smoke detector system in my house, but still give me the bonus of being alerted in the event of fire or carbon monoxide.However, I decided not to use it because there is no way to cancel a false alarm and I don't want the fire department showing up every time steam from a shower or burned food sets off my smoke detectors.I suppose it's a liability issue where Ring wants to err on the side of caution instead of waiting to call emergency services.I really wish that there was an option to send you an alert so you can opt to NOT contact the fire department...** Update **After posting my review, I received an email response from a Ring representative and I’m updating my review to reflect my new understanding of how Ring Professional Monitoring handles these alarms.  I DO still wish the app gave you more choice to control this which would also make it more clear as to what’ll happen in the event of an alarm detection.Apparently, I misunderstood how/when the Ring professional monitoring contacts emergency services.  I guess when a fire is detected, they WILL attempt to call the listed contacts before calling emergency services.I’m posting that response here as it may be useful information for other potential buyers:“ Hello Aaron,Please allow me to introduce myself. My name is Jamila and I am an Amazon Executive Community Support Representative specialized in Ring Alarm devices.I came across your review "Decided to not use it"on Amazon for the Ring Alarm Smoke and Co Listener. I want to thank you for sharing your experience with us. I understand that you are having some concerns with your smoke and co listener and I would like to provide you with some information.If a fire is detected the monitoring station will call the first contact before dispatching police. If the first contact does not answer/requests dispatch, then a dispatch request will be made. The remaining contacts on your list are called, and if anyone can be reached, they are notified of the emergency and may be given the opportunity to try to cancel if it's a false alarm.In the event that CO is detected, it will dispatch the fire department first and then your emergency contacts are given a call. Please click here ​to see our help center article titled - Getting a Call from Ring’s Professional Monitoring Center for more information.If you’d like to work together over email, please reply directly to this email. If you’d prefer a phone call, please let me know the best contact number to reach you, along with the best days and times to call you.I want to thank you for taking the time to write a review on Amazon, and I look forward to hearing from you. “

reviewTitle: Support was good (Was: Whoever did the setup instructions messed up)
reviewDescription: EDIT: I finally had a call with the person from Ring support. She was very knowledgeable, and she totally understood my feedback about how the instructions and the feedback given by the app and the device were misleading. Original review below:I tried to give this feedback on the Ring site, but that thing seems almost designed to frustrate that sort of thing, so here goes here. The instructions for doing the "learning mode" seem clear, if as the writer, you're a bit of a slacker, but a key part of it isn't thought through. Judging by some of the negative reviews, many others are having problems because of this. The key part is this: It's not clear when the device is and isn't in "test/learning" mode! Since the setup screens have this one picture with a big black arrow pointing at a button, they will press it. This puts the device into "test/learn" mode. THEN, when they are subsequently prompted to press the button, they are taking the device out of "test/learn" mode! Such users will then dutifully go through the test, and see the red light reacting to the sounds, but the test will never successfully complete.I finally figured this out. This tells me that the setup instructions for this product were not thoroughly tested by genuine users unfamiliar with the device. On the surface, it looks like ok instructions. However, there needs to be more and earlier explanation, combined with better feedback from the device and app when things aren't going the correct way. The app should be getting a signal about the sound detection without the alarm detection, so it can warn the user the device is in the wrong state. Instead, the reacting lights fool the user into think the device is in the test/learn state.I hope someone at Ring gets this feedback, looks at some of the negative reviews, and thinks a little more deeply about this.

reviewTitle: NOT A SMOKE ALARM - A LISTENER
reviewDescription: I made the mistake of thinking this was an actual smoke alarm.  When I received the unit I was surprised to see that is a listener that you place beside an existing smoke alarm.  When your smoke alarm activates, the listener hears it and alerts your Ring Security System. The listener has to be placed inches away from the existing smoke alarm, so you need one set beside each of your existing smoke alarms.  Ring Customer Service helped me with a return and I was able to purchase First Alert Z Wave Smoke alarms that can link directly with my Ring Security System without a listener. The Ring Security System recognizes the First Alert Z Wave Smoke / CO alarm with no problem. This option eliminated purchasing regular smoke alarms and then a Ring Listener to install beside each smoke alarm.  The First Alert Z Wave alarms saved me $$$ and installation time.  Also saved with maintenance on so many units and batteries. Ring Customer Service and Support were very helpful to resolve my issue.

reviewTitle: Ok so far, but can't turn down or off the alarm.
reviewDescription: After a few frustrating attempts to set this up and connect it to my ring system, the biggest issue I have is that you can't turn down or off the additional alarm sound that this emits. So, in our case we had a brand new oven that set off the nearest smoke alarm every time you opened it. In addition to the super load regular alarm, this "listener" is also alarming super loudly and adding to the stress of making the sounds go away. I guess it would be good to have in an actual fire situation, but if your alarms are like mine, there is no chance you are not going to hear them. The added noise just isn't needed. At a minimum you should be able to control the alarm volume through the app.

reviewDescription: I bought a full ring system (base, contact sensors, flood/freeze sensors, lights, motion detectors) and had zero issues with anything EXCEPT for the smoke/CO listener. I tried to chat with ring, email ring to RMA out this obviously-defective sensor and for zero response (their chat doesn’t work and the email must have went into an abyss because that was weeks ago and I’ve heard nothing). Funny how the one sensor that your life could actually depend on doesn’t work...in all fairness technology isn’t without its fails, my real issue is the lack of support. Very concerning. I can’t recommend this product or really any of them is this is what happens when you have an issue.***EDIT*** after writing this review I was contacted by Amazon/Ring customer service within 1 day to resolve the issue and they replaced the defective sensor. It’s a shame this is the only way I was able to get assistance for this issue but they did make it right so changed from 1 star to 4 stars.

reviewTitle: Ring has now enabled some features to where it plays a short sound on the base station.
reviewDescription: The flood and freeze sensor came as part of our alarm kit. Honestly living in Florida away from the water I figured it was kind of a throwaway extra. The only place I could think to put it was in the garage between our hot water heater and our extra freezer figuring it’d catch if one of them leaked. To my great surprise I woke up to a robo call at 8am about two weeks later saying water was detected. Sure enough I went into the garage to find the sensor in a small puddle of water. It was not the water heater or the freezer though. Apparently there was a crack in our exterior wall letting our neighbors’ sprinkler water seep through the wall. The puddle was in the corner of my garage just by chance where I put the sensor and I never would have caught it without this sensor. This thing works and saved us from a bigger issue had we not caught this unexpected problem. I’m so happy we got it!

reviewDescription: Works fine, easy install.However, for the same 35 bucks you can get a zWave first alert wired smoke and CO detector which has a much longer battery life (10 years vs 3 years for this listener).

3 Tips from my listening install:  1)  Grab some earplugs for alarm test if you can, 2) Test the listener with the smoke alarm before drilling holes to avoid excess holes in your ceiling / wall, and 3) Install the listener as close to the smoke alarm as possible (arrow on the mounting bracket pointing towards the smoke alarm).  Background: I have a kiddie combo smoke/CO alarm that I wanted to put the listener next to.  The instructions say to put it within 6 inches and the arrow on the mounting bracket pointing towards the smoke alarm. My listener paired with the ring base station successfully.  Then I installed as instructed, at 6 inches using their template.  During the test the listener blinks red in unison with the smoke alarm chimes (which is a good thing) so it seemed like it heard the alarm ok. But the Ring App didn't recognize a successful test.  So I spent an hour on the phone with the Ring tech (he was very patient :)  ).  We finally figured out that I have to put the listener right next to the smoke alarm (again with the arrow pointing towards the alarm) in order for the listener test to show success in the ring app. Unfortunately, now I need to remove the mounting bracket, fill the holes, drill new holes immediately next to the smoke, and remount.  Grrr  And hopefully my hearing will recover from all the testing of the alarm.  Aside from that, I love not having to replace all my relatively new, wired, functioning smoke alarms with smart alarms...  and just using a listener instead.

Updated:03/26/2020After communication with Ring Customer support who recommended removing the Z-Wave device (Ring Alarm Smoke and CO Listener) from the Base Station, then re-install, the Ring Alarm Smoke and CO Listener finally completed the install successfully and it is able to identify the Smoke and CO signals from the Smoke and CO Alarm.Updating the rating to 3 stars since there is the issue where out of the box brand new the install did not work; only after removing the Z-Wave device then re-install did the Ring Alarm Smoke and CO Listener work.Original review 1 star -  03/24/2020The Ring Alarm Smoke and CO Listener is unable to detect alarm signals from latest UL listed Smoke and CO Alarm.The Ring Ring Alarm Smoke and CO Listener was unable to complete installation since it was not able to detect alarm signals from Smoke and CO Alarm that is UL listed and manufactured in 2019.Even after re-installing the Ring Alarm Smoke and CO Listener a second time it still could not successfully detect alarm signals from a UL Listed Smoke and CO Alarm  with manufacturing date in 2019. Neither could it detect the alarm signals from other UL listed Smoke and CO Alarms that are a couple years older than 2019.The unit is either defective or it just does not work as advertised. reviewTitle: Missing features and some duds out of the box
reviewDescription: First off, know what you’re buying. These aren’t smoke detectors. They sit next to the smoke detectors you already have and listen for the smoke detectors to go off. They generally work well in that regard, but a) they don’t work with Ring chimes, so if you have a Ring chime, don’t expect it to alert you when a detector is triggered b) one of the four in the box didn’t connect to my Ring system even after a lot of troubleshooting, which I considered to be a dud. Kind of a disappointment, but I think I’d rather have these things than not have them.

reviewTitle: This is only a listener.  Unless you have a hardwired system, why not buy a z-wave detector?
reviewDescription: I really don't see any reason to buy this unless you have a new detector that you want it to listen to.  You install this 3 to 6 inches from a late model smoke detector or CO detector.  For about the same price, you can buy a combination DETECTOR (not a listener), such as the Ring-compatible First Alert Z-Wave Smoke & Carbon Monoxide Detector.After reading Ring's customer service response below, I changed my rating from one star to three stars.  I decided to order a First Alert Z-Wave detector for the application that I originally intended and set up the Ring listener in a different room.  I get Ring's point about their device being intended for a hard wired detector, but didn't see that stated in the Amazon product description before I bought it.  Two points off for not stating the design purpose in the product description.  I'm setting up a new Ring security system, am happy with it, and customer support has been fantastic.

If you plan to get more than 1 of these devices for your house. You will waste your money.Because, if one of your detectors gives the alarm, the others will alarm at the same time and you will never know where is the actual alarming location. So this device is useless for determining the alarm location.

It works buy i dont understand what happens if my alarms go off.I did put it next to my fire alarm and when i pushed the test buttons the alarm sounded and the ring device did light up so it is hearing just fine...There isnt much config settings for the device but i think ring will send some updates soon

Set up took forever and had a lot of trouble setting this up to my ring alarm system. I assume it works though but I haven’t had my smoke detectors or CO alarm go off so I don’t know how effective this product is.

reviewTitle: Good idea, lots of room for improvement.
reviewDescription: Added this to a whole house of Nest Protects. The listener can’t tell the difference between a test and a real alarm so you’ll have to put it into test mode whenever you want to test your smoke alarms. I had to turn the automatic monthly sound check on the Protects off as it’s not possible to coordinate test times with the listener automatically.
I bought this product thinking it would tell me if something is burning but it doesn't.

reviewTitle: Just buy a real alarm instead of a listener.
reviewDescription: Listener works as advertised but I would recommend simply buying the first alert z wave smoke and Co alarm. It will also pair with Ring and doesn't require two things mounted on your wall. Also, it's about the same price.

Excellent idea. I already had alarms and didn't want to purchase new ones,  so i got this instead. My alarm sounds for smoke and carbon monoxide,  and it detects the sound and notified Ring IMMEDIATELY.
Had a slightly difficult time connecting this to my fire alarm but it is now on successfully. Didn't really care about getting this in my kit but since I have it I'll use it
I had issues trying to make it work, (sound test with my smoke alarm) that is the only reason for the 4 starts, the product itself is solid and works fine, once tested.
I did not need it. My home is new and already has this installed. I did not know
The ring ALARM system is very good and well worth the money!!

Alright this thing would’ve saved my house if it had been a real alarm. My smoke detector went off in the kitchen when I was cooking and it immediately set off the Ring listener. Within a few seconds, Ring support called me to confirm a real emergency or not.

reviewTitle: Added to monitored system...Great response time
reviewDescription: Added this to my monitored system in February 2019. When I recently changed out the smoke detector I forgot to disable the listener. I tested the new detector which within seconds set off the ring system...less than a minute later I got a call from RING to make sure everything was ok. I'm very satisfied with this device and especially with the monitoring service and would recommend it to everyone with the Ring system.

My brother burned bacon and the alarm started going off and it was so loud we didn’t hear when ring was calling to make sure we were ok. I thought I deactivated the alarm on time but 5-7 minutes later the firefighters showed up. This definitely worked so just be careful.

Another great product from the Ring team. This device is installed inches next to one of your smoke/CO detectors inside your house. Our detectors are hard wired, so if one goes off they all go off. Upon testing this device will activate when the smoke detector is activated alerting the monitoring company of the fire. This is a must to add fire detection to your ring security system.

reviewTitle: Small and easy to install sensor
reviewDescription: Turns your smoke alarm into a smart a sensor. It’s half the size of my First Alert smoke detector and very easy to install. It detected the alarm going off quickly when testing. I’m very happy with it and don’t feel the need to spend a lot more on a direct wire system that is Ring controllable.

Update!!!! Ring's customer service is incredible.  Sent me a replacement after my first review.  The new one seems to be working great.  Thanks Ring.  It's nice to know that they stand behind their products.

reviewTitle: You only need 1 if your smoke detectors are connected
reviewDescription: The detector works great.  I was able to get the notification through the app when I tested the alarm.  If your smoke detectors are connected (meaning when one goes off, they all go off), you only need to put this next to one of them.

Very easy to set up. Had the whole system running in less than an hour. One sensor wasn’t communicating but a quick call to ring and I’m am 100% percent. Easy controls for the user and can customize with minimal effort. Monitoring costs are the cheapest in the industry so one more reason to buy.

reviewTitle: You'll be notified promptly, and loudly!
reviewDescription: I accidentally set the smoke alarm off by cooking, err, burning some food on the stove and WOWZERS. This thing will sound off like nobody's business, I'm talking alerts directly to your cell phone and the whole nine yards. We're already users and fans of Ring alarm and camera components, so this was a no brainer.
its just a listener

One of the biggest issue is not giving customers ability to control the fire alarm. Its pretty common to have false alarms when cooking. Trradtionally i used to open my windows and stop the alarm. Ring gives you only 30 seconds to get your act together. If you are unable to stop thr alarm. Emergency gets disptaces.If ring would have given option to control peofessional monitoring for smoke it woudl have been awesome. For now, this is lot to ask!

reviewTitle: It won’t listen to your alarms in entire house, it only listens to one or two nearby alarms
reviewDescription: If you think this listener will listen smoke/CO alarms of your entire house like I did, you are totally wrong. In the installation instruction, it asks you to place it 3 to 6 inch near your existing smoke/CO detector, and it asks you to point the listener (several holes on the listener) towards your existing alarm. Obviously it won’t listen to far away alarms in other rooms. Then I thought alright it at least would listen to both my smoke and CO detector in the hallway which are not far away from each other. I was wrong again. When testing, it only respond to the nearest smoke alarm but won’t respond to a nearby CO alarm. So I end up with moving the CO alarm close to the listener until the listener can respond. So I end up with placing three devices on the wall — my existing smoke alarm, existing CO alarm, and the listener. I would rather buy the First Alert z-wave smoke and CO detector instead, which will detector smoke and CO as well as send signals to ring base station. And it will be only one device on the wall - nice and simple. I will return the listener if it’s not a part of the ring home security bundle.

I purchased a Ring Alarm system during 2020/Dec, and was therefore more of less forced to buy this sensor add fire detection monitoring.  Getting the Ring app to detect this zwave device was pretty difficult, however, just like the Ring Flood/Freeze Sensor.My biggest issue was that I was unaware that this device must be mounted extremely close to my fire alarm (six inches!).  I find that extremely surprising, because my $25 Wyze Cam 2 cameras can both detect the fire alarm siren and they are both far away from my fire alarms.  So what about my $ 60 Ring Indoor camera?  It can't detect fire alarm sirens.During the initial siren test, I had to hold my Ring Smoke/CO2 sensor adjacent to my fire alarm in order for the sensor to "hear" the siren.  Because of that, I'd say this sensor certainly needs an upgrade.

reviewTitle: If your smoke alarm goes off, the monitoring center will be notified even your alarm is disarmed
reviewDescription: Easy to install and reasonable price. No option for user to choose to monitor or not as other sensors. If your smoke or CO alarm goes off, the listener will alert monitoring center no matter what mode your alarm is in. You cannot choose what mode to monitor or not like other sensors. Even you are home, disarm your alarm, and your smoke alarm goes off from your cooking, they will call you or dispath the police. This sounds like a big headache to me. Not sure why Ring does not allow users to customize this sensor like other sensors so they can choose to self monitor or alert the monitoring center.

reviewTitle: No configuration for preventing dispatch during false alarm
reviewDescription: Before you purchase, please be aware that there is no option to not have this monitored ALL the time. This means any false alarm will dispatch fire to your house. Ring should allow the configuration of call verification before dispatching or allow the device alerts to be suppressed temporarily from the app. We have a smoke detector in the kitchen (which is not ideal but it is hard wired this way) which goes off from time to time. I don't want the fire department showing up whenever something gets burned a bit in the oven.

These have to be mounted close to each your existing decetors to work. I bought one thinking I could mount it in a central location in the home and it would alert if any one of my smoke detectors went off. Couldn't justify the cost. Returned this and ordered a wireless z wave that worked great. I have a ring system and love it.

reviewTitle: You need a Ring Alarm base station to use this
reviewDescription: I didn't realize you need a Ring Alarm Base Station to use this. No thank you, I'm not invested in the Ring ecosystem.Will find another solution, like Wyze

Not easy to install.  Took second level to get it to work....Installed two listeners both an issue to get working.  Took more that one person to get it to work.  Instruction not clear to install.  Take support to get them to install.
Ring has nice products, too bad the App sucks so bad (keeps crashing, impossible to check past events without it crashing, etc.)
Installed as instructed, tested and worked. But, among about 10 alarms, this listener only ring 4 times. Not trustable and not worth the cost.
Seems to work fine - but I am now receiving a low battery notice...  It was installed less than two months ago.  Not good.
It worked great, but after 30 days the 3V battery went dead! That’s a $10 3 year battery! They sent me a new battery but 2 months later the battery is dead again!
1/2 the fire listeners don’t even work, they won’t connect, waste of money. Do not use nest. Shi*t manufacturing
Has to be mounted close to 2 to 3 inches from the alarm.

reviewTitle: Good so far, battery lasted 3 days
reviewDescription: Setup was simple and seems to work fine.  Battery lasted three days after the strip was removed during installation.

reviewTitle: Install this if you want Fire Department Called Even if you Press Test
reviewDescription: This thing says in the ad when I bought it and still says it today, that it does not detect anything. It does not detect fire, smoke, or CO. Therefore, all it does is listens to your in home detectors and has no way of knowing anything about the particular issue itself. Here is what happened with me...My in home detectors aggravated the heck out of me with the dreaded low battery chirp. So I go buy a 9volt, get on the ladder and change it. While I am there, I decided let me test my detectors. Forgetting to put that ring listener in test mode. 5 seconds later, Ring alarm is alarming, 5 seconds later I cancel via the app, 5 seconds later, the monitoring people call me and ask if everything is ok. I say yes, i was just testing and forgot to put it in test mode. They then say well we will send the fire department no matter what. I am like why, they said because its CO alert. I said no its not, because i was just testing and a listener doesnt detect anything. They said oh well we are sending them anyway because that's our policy and no matter what you say that's what we are doing. And they did, the fire department was at my door within 3 minutes. All great responses if it was an actual emergency. The said part is Ring is basically randomly deciding to flag everything at CO level even when the device doesnt know the difference and then they do not allow you to cancel that type of alarm and will send the fire department no matter what you say. This device fraudulently flags things as CO when it doesnt know the difference. I want my money back!!!!

We live in a rural area with a volunteer fire department. If the fire alarm goes off, the "listener" picks it up and trips the alarm, causing the monitoring company to automatically call the fire department and dispatch them. The volunteer fire department is not free. If they are dispatched it is an automatic $800.00, fire or not. It was about 10:00 p.m. inthe evening, we were home. The fire alarm beeped.....a warning that the battery needed replacing. The "listener" heard that, tripped the alarm, and instantly the monitoring company dispatched the fire department. In the meanwhile we frantically disarmed the system and called the monitoring company to cancel the alarm. The lady REFUSED to cancel the alarm! We BEGGED her, PLEADED with her, explaining repeatedly that the alarm was just a battery notification. She absolutely refused to cancel the alarm and HUNG UP ON US! What? HUNG UP? The fire department showed up. We apologized and sent them back home to their families. We paid the $800.00 bill when it came a week later. We threw the "listener" in the garbage. Now our system has no fire alarm except the generic ones on the walls that are useless unless we are home. I imagine the same thing would happen with alarms connected to the house electricity if the electric was interrupted. We notified Ring by email and phone message to tell them of the glitch in the "listener" and the stupidity and rudeness of the lady at the monitoring company. No one returned either communication.  Way to go RING.

reviewTitle: Doesn't work with all smoke detectors
reviewDescription: I bought this Ring detector along with X-Sense smoke/CO detectors from Amazon. Obviously, the X-Sense are brand new and recent vintage. I spent over an hour on the phone with a Ring representative trying to get it to test OK on my cell phone, and they finally gave up and shipped me a new one. The same thing happened with the second one. Finally, the second Ring representative I talked with said that unless the smoke alarm emits a certain type of signal, it is not compatible with the Ring sensor, and probably the X-Sense are not compatible. The representative said there is something on the Ring website about this, but all the Amazon website (where I bought it from) says is that this is compatible with "an existing smoke and/or carbon monoxide detector 10 years old or less that complies with all applicable standards". I purchased the smoke detector brand new from Amazon and it is apparently not compatible with this Ring sensor. This is frustrating as I spend over two hours trying to get this to work, and the first Ring representative I talked with did not know about the incompatibility.

Shame on me, I didn’t realize this wasn’t a smoke detector but rather a detector listener (meaning it needs a separate non Ring device to detect smoke first). That said, when I bought actual smoke detectors, this device, which is supposed to “listen” for the alarms, could not hear when the detector when off! Meanwhile my neighbors can hear these smoke detection alarms.We have a number of Ring devices we’re generally pleased with. This one has the limited functionality of listening to real detectors, and it cannot even do that! Avoid.

Don't buy this sensor unless you fully understand the requirements.  At the time, the Amazon smartphone app failed to mention you need the Ring Alarm Kit for another $200 in order for this to work.  You simply cannot add it as another sensor to your Ring subscription (like I have done so with numerous cameras).  Now that the return window has passed, I'm stuck with the sensor and wasted money.  Spending over 45 minutes with Amazon Chat attempting a return was a complete waste of time.  It's too bad you can't select a zero star review.

This smoke alarm listener does what it is intended to do - it listens for your smoke alarm and alarms the Ring system.  The problem is that there is no time to then disarm the alarm to prevent the fire department from being dispatched.  In the middle of cooking (and perhaps lightly charring something on the stove, the air fryer or in the oven) my extremely sensitive fire alarms start going off, the Ring system starts alarming and then my phone rings - all at the same time.  I attempt to use the Ring app to disarm the alarm but so far it has never worked.  I have to step outside to speak with the Ring dispatcher while it is absolute chaos in my house.  (Luckily I have been able to find my phone each time but one of these days my phone may be in another room.)  I guess this is the way that it is supposed to work if your home is really on fire but...I set my very sensitive fire alarms off at least once or twice a month.  Anyway, the process is very stressful so we are uninstalling the listener for now unless Ring updates the system to allow for a self-monitoring option.  We would like the ability to have at least 5 minutes to disarm the system before the Ring monitoring center dispatches the fire department.  That is an option that could be easily added to this system.

Despite detecting the signal chirp from my smoke detector (as in the device turns red during testing), the ring app states that the listener isn’t detecting a signal, and will not finish setup. The testing is stressing my dogs out, so I’m exchanging this for a bonafide ring smoke detector, since it looks like I need a specific kind of smoke detector with this product.

Caused a false alarm.  Fire dept showed up (Thank you guys and very sorry for the trouble!) and a relative was inconvenienced by having to go to my house since I was away that night.NO RESPOSNSE AT ALL FROM RING after several attempts to get a rebate/redund.

There is a known issue where the devices show "tampered" non-stop. I'm talking 100 notifications in 10 minutes. I purchased 2 months ago but was a little late in setting it up. Amazon is refusing a replacement because it's outside the return window. There's no support for damaged products and they wanted to offer me a one time exception of a return while paying a restocking fee?? for a product that doesn't work? Why would they go and restock that?I paid over 1k on my full system and they can't be bothered to replace a $60 piece.

I take some of the blame because I bought these assuming they were regular smoke and carbon monoxide detectors without reading the fine print. That being said, it says smoke alarm and carbon monoxide detector by ring. I thought it would be a nice addition to the ring family of products in my house. I just started installing them after purchasing them in October and realize that they just listen to the smoke alarms. You already have in your house! You can buy something that connects to your ring system for the same price. I don’t want to stupid devices in my house next to each other. I guess I’m stuck with these.

reviewTitle: A good product but a serious problem
reviewDescription: A good idea to interface ring to an existing smoke alarm system, easy to install and use. But if there is a problem with this unit, so that it reports alarms that never happened, the fire department will be called. And this device cannot be disabled remotely, even if it is known to be defective and generating regular false reports.

reviewTitle: Unistalled for false alrms on monitored Ring
reviewDescription: Installed easily, added easily, but my smoke detector had a low battery (changed yearly) it chirped and the monitored system activated the Fire department with no ability to stop it.The friendly staff did call and let me know, but I can't have false alarms. If there was a way to be certain it would not cause false alarms, I would use it. Some form of verification that it is indeed a true alarm.Until then I have purchased Nest Protects, disabled this detector and will active the alarm myself if needed, doesn't help for CO if I were unconscious, but smoke alarms chirp, they always have, and they always will.

WE HAVE THE COMPLETE RING SYSTEM WITH WINDOWS, MOTION AND SMOKE DETECTORS PLUS A PRO DOOR BELL.  AT FIRST I THOUGHT I HAD HIT THE MOTHER LOAD IT WORKED VERY WELL.  THEN THREE OR FOUR MONTHS IN I STARTED GETTING NOTICES THAT THIS ONE OR THAT ONE WAS OFF LINE.  WE HAVE TWO HOMES AND SO IT WAS CONCERNING TO HAVE ONE OFF LINE ALMOST EVERY DAY.  WE WOULD UP BY PASSING ON OCCASIONS.

reviewTitle: Maybe this is a good product
reviewDescription: I hope I never have to find out if this product will work as advertised, but the install was not as easy as I thought. It is directional and the testing is temperamental. I continue to have "tamper" status because I had to open and reset several times to get the device to setup normally.

reviewTitle: This in not a fire alarm. You have to buy that separately.
reviewDescription: This only listens to your fire alarm, as you must purchase a fire alarm separately. It listens great, but its an additional charge on top of the purchase of a fire alarm, so its value seems a bit low. It really should be a lot cheaper or cost a bit more and have a built in fire alarm.

Not clear when I bought it that this requires the rest of the security system. I installed Device on ceiling... and spent about 2 hours trying to debug.I looked online for support and found this requires security system- now to return.

There is no reason at all these can’t listen for multiple smoke alarms. Instead Ring has them configured to hear only the one that it’s sitting right next to (6”), thus you have to buy one for literally every detector in your house.

This device cannot pick up SPOKEN/VERBAL CO and fire alarms. Other customers who report that once this alarm is triggered, it automatically causes a fire dispatch that you can't cancel which results in large fines and makes this a very risky install.

reviewTitle: Not useful u need system hub
reviewDescription: Does not work without ring hub

reviewTitle: this is not the actual sensor but just a data cop
reviewDescription: need to get the sensor that works with Z wave
Receiving 4 PC's of  smok detector not 5 as requested
Works
Easy to install. FYI you must have a smoke/co detector for it to be useful.

reviewTitle: Smoke Alarm Sound Listener that effectively augments your Ring Alarm System with Smoke Detection
reviewDescription: The Ring Alarm System Sensor Smoke and Carbon Monoxide listener works effectively as a device that listens to the audible alarms from a smoke detector that is within 6 inches of the device.  I have tested it with a Nest Protect smoke alarm mounted 3 inches away from this device and it functioned correctly.  The setup was not as easy as I thought it would be since placement is critical for the listener to detect your smoke alarm sounds.  I used double sided tape to mount it on clean wiped down area versus included mounting screws.  Need to be at least 3 inches from the Nest Protect and no closer and not much farther away.  I held listener on ceiling before mounting at less than 3 inches and it did not detect the smoke alarm sounding which was odd.  The sound from a Nest Protect is loud.  Once it detected smoke alarm I marked location and installed it.  You know it is detecting each sound from your smoke alarm when a red ring is displayed on the listener.  Quite expensive for what it is but works and enables professional monitoring service to monitor smoke and carbon monoxide detection in your home.

Easy to install but not very easy to setup. Took a good hour to finally link it to my wifi. had to reset the device 5 times before it connected. Other than that works pretty well. Already had the fire department called twice. ( baking cookies on parchment paper. )

reviewTitle: adds smoke detectors to ring monitoring
reviewDescription: Our insurance company wanted to know if our smoke detectors were remotely monitored...answer, no. But with this, it's easy to add it to our remotely monitored Ring security system. Insurance company is now happy.
Set was quick, tested it, works
Super easy to install and to configure...highly recommended!

Exactly what we needed to add to my grandma’s Ring system for our peace of mind. She lives alone, and now, if her smoke alarms go off we can receive a notification and check in on her and/or take necessary action. It helps us feel a little more secure and helps her stay her in her home safely for a little longer. Thanks, Ring!
Easy to install works as described

reviewTitle: This is NOT a smoke or CO detector!!!!!!
reviewDescription: This is NOT a smoke or CO detector!!!!!! I’m seeing a lot of reviews from people that are disappointed that they thought that they were ordering a detector and did not read the product description before purchasing. It works with the Ring home security system and alerts Ring (and possibly your local police and/or fire department, depending on where you live) if one of your detectors has gone off in your home. That way the proper authorities are informed if you’re not home.
I paired this with a wireless, Interconnected smoke / CO alarm system for a fraction of the ring stand alone combo detectors. No issues. Works as advertised.
Nice

reviewTitle: Works perfectly for the ring system
reviewDescription: Works perfectly.  Make sure you read the instructions for installing it. It is not a smoke or CO detector.  It listens for the sound of your smoke detector when it goes off, then alerts your ring system. Very easy to install.

Easy to mount on the ceiling and test. This is a great way to keep piece of mind about any possibility of a fire while away from home.Was somewhat disappointed that within one hour of installation it signaled that the battery was almost dead. It had the paper strip in it that I pulled out, but apparently the battery was losing power or not good before I received it.

reviewTitle: If you cook do not buy
reviewDescription: No option to put the listener in pause mode while cooking. Had more than a few calls, interrupted cooking, for false cooking alarms on smoke detectors. DO NOT BUY IF YOU COOK and your smoke detector has gone off. I have complained to Ring. Need an app pause button for listeners. Otherwise the benefits are not worth the hassle. Do not buy. I will need to deinstall mine, the only viable option, bummer.

If you enjoy getting woken up at 2 am for a false alarm this is the product for you. I am not talking about a false alarm in which my smoke detector actually went off inappropriately and my ring listener set off the alarm appropriately — I am talking about a situation in which my smoke alarm did NOT go off and yet my ring listener still set off the alarm.I have removed the listener and won’t be using it again.

reviewTitle: Does not work with all smoke detectors!  Few older or hardwired ones!
reviewDescription: Only after buying this, installing, and testing multiple times, with my super loud hardwired smoke detection system, did I see the very fine print that this only works on certain sounds from detectors. So chances are if you have a cheap alarm that chirps it might work. You also must install within 5” of the alarm, which seems odd. If it’s so loud why doesn’t it work from 1’ away or more???

reviewTitle: They don’t pear up to the base Station
reviewDescription: Can’t get them to pair up to the base station even with tech-support on the phone. Musta wasted at least two hours on these things not worth it.

The idea of it is great! If you can figure out how to get Ring to recognize it. I can't find any mention of it other than to how to buy it on Amazon. Scanning it repeatedly didn't make Ring acknowledge it. I tried to get information from the Ring community, seems others are having the same or similar issues.

reviewTitle: False alarmed in middle of the night, triggering fire department.  Mine is junk.
reviewDescription: I would not recommend.  Went off about a month after install in the middle of the night for no reason.  Didn’t answer my phone in time and Ring monitoring called the fire department.  Met them in my underwear to tell them it was a false alarm.  Ended up removing from my Ring system and removing the battery.  Maybe a quality control issue, but mine is junk.

The ring co/smoke listening device is not a stellar design. Not even a "one stellar." Battery life is very poor - I was prompted to write a review after my 6th battery in less than 2 years.  Other ring devices are still operating on the initial battery.  Plus, a chirp out of your smoke detector can set it off, and good luck trying to restore it to normal.  Ring should redesign this POS, and replace all existing units.

As others have mentioned, it doesn't recognize my smoke detector sound (even though the light on the sensor lights up red). I'm using it in a recently bought condo with what appears to be brand new detectors. It does recognize my CO detector on the first try, however. It also costs about the same as the First Alert combination CO/Smoke detector that has Z-wave built in. It also only has a 30 day return window, so that's money down the drain in my case.

reviewTitle: Do not buy. Is is listening? Mine doesn't.
reviewDescription: Ok, so after having this "listening" for the last 4 months I realized it doesnt work. Im very frustrated that it is 1 inch from my smoke detector in a 7 year old house, and it doesn't work at all. Wow. Cool, not really, at all. I put my trust in the hands of this unit, and that was a bad idea. All in all, not really liking anything about this security system. I would not recommend, nor have I since owing it.

reviewTitle: Can’t use without ring alarm system
reviewDescription: I was super excited about this product, but disappointed to find out I didn’t read the details enough to realize I have to also have a ring security system in order to use this device. No wonder it seemed like such a good price! I wasn’t interested in purchasing a security system too so I just returned the product
Does not tell you, you have to already have the ring security system for this to work

reviewTitle: Does not work with X-Sense smoke alarms!
reviewDescription: Worked with Ring tech support to install this device. It was the second try. Ring has confirmed the sound pattern of these alarms are not compatible with the ring listener. There is no fix for now.

The device looks good and works well and it was easy to do initial setup. However, less than one month after setup the device went offline without any warning or message about why. Give that the device wasn’t responding, I guessed the battery was depleted. Replaced the battery and basically had to setup all over again, for some reason. Another month has passed, the device is offline again and not responding. It seems to consume one battery per month and gives no warning of low battery level. Very disappointing…

reviewTitle: MUST HAVE RING BASE STATION - Will not work with APP
reviewDescription: This product will NOT work through the app, you must have the ring base station to get this work. That is total BS since all the other cameras and doorbells work thru the app!
Listing does not specify that you need to purchase a ring home base in order to use this product. So you must buy into their whole ecosystem if you just want to use this listener.

reviewTitle: Only works with certain smoke detectors
reviewDescription: Like all ring security devices, they don’t tell you that it is incompatible with many smoke detectors until you’ve already screwed it into the wall and then need to call them because it won’t connect.

reviewTitle: not a smoke detector or carbon dioxide detector
reviewDescription: Had no idea this was not a smoke detector or carbon dioxide detector. Kind of dumb to have something titled smoke/carbon dioxide listener. Just make a smoke detector shaking my head. I’m outside of the return window, so can’t even return it.

Instead of integrating the smoke or carbon monoxide sensor directly as a component into the system, Ring, instead offers this listening device that has the potential to stop working and not detect the CO alarm.  Ring system does not work reliably.  There are better, safer options!

reviewTitle: Can’t get this to work, at all.
reviewDescription: I’ve been through The instructions dozens of times. I have it installed right next to a carbon monoxide alarm and I can get this monitor hooked up to my alarm system I get it in test mode and it never hears the carbon monoxide alarm even though I am going deaf now because of all the testing! One day I’ll have to reach out to Ring Support but this is ridiculous. I also cannot send it back because I am outside of the window.
It would be nice if they told you right there with the main info but I’m sure it’s five star with the base

reviewTitle: It is NOT a smoke detector!

reviewTitle: Good for Whole House Smoke/CO Systems
reviewDescription: With Ring, you have two choices when it comes to alerting you and others that smoke or CO is in the house:  a First Alert smoke/CO detector with Z-wave technology or this listener. Because I have a hard-wired system where every alarm goes off when one does, the listener was the most cost-effective.  I need only one listener instead of several detectors placed throughout the house.  If we didn't have a whole-house system, then I would have gotten one listener for each floor since it still would have been fewer devices than if I placed new detectors in every bedroom and hallway.As with all Ring security devices, this listener was a breeze to install and activate.  Just follow the instructions on the app, and it's added to your list within minutes.  The most time consuming part is installing it 6" or less from an existing detector.  That is as difficult as drilling holes and screwing the base in.  If you have a hard-wired, whole-house system, you can select any alarm to place it next to, even in an out-of-the-way location.  Note:  If you are connected to Ring's service, make sure you follow the instructions to put it in test mode so that it doesn't trigger a response.I love my Ring security system, and this listener add functionality that I didn't expect when I first bought into the system.-- Debbie Lee Wesselmann

reviewTitle: Peace of Mind, Respond to a Fire Faster or While You Are Away, But Not Perfect
reviewDescription: This Ring Alarm device is far from perfect, but is a great way to add fire/CO alerting and response to your home monitoring and existing Ring Alarm service.  Where properly installed with working fire detection systems and tested, and with monitoring, it should alert emergency response much faster than a neighbor noticing an externally visible fire while you are away, or you getting out and then calling the fire department after it is safe to do so.  I'd still call anyway, not blindly expect that alerting worked.LISTENER NOT DETECTOR:The key difference here is that it is just a "listener", not a detector.  It does not do any detection of smoke, fire, or CO levels itself.  Otherwise I suspect it would have to comply with a lot more testing and regulation, 10-year battery life requirements (which this does not have), and would have to be completely replaced every 10 years or so (see current advice & regulations for smoke & CO detectors).  So this one just buddies up to existing detectors that do comply, and listens for the alarm from that device.  It can tell whether it is next to a Fire/Smoke or CO detector by the technically unique sound each make.  Supposedly "temporal 3" is used by fire alarm, and "temporal 4" is used by CO gas alarms, and it can tell the difference, and respond with different emergency protocols (but not that you can control).INSTALLATION:There is a simple back plate to mount on a wall with screws.  It doesn't come with double-sided tape for alternative easier installation (not sure why not), but is easy enough to make a mark with the back plate and drill 2 holes.  It can only be installed in one direction facing your existing detector, has an arrow on the back plate itself, and must be placed 3 to 6 inches from your existing detector and pointed towards the right direction to listen for it.  Just add to your ring service through the Ring app as usual, scan the QR code, and put it into test mode to make sure it recognizes the detector sounding, and then mark it done.  It comes with an easy to replace Panasonic CR123A Industrial Lithium battery, comes fully charged, and the Ring app will tell you when the battery gets low or sensor goes offline.DRAWBACKS:(1) They can only be placed within 3-6 inches of your existing detectors, and facing a certain way.  Thsi might not be ideal on some surfaces that you might not want to disturb.  I wish it would just listen like all the Echo devices that have a setting that can alert you if a smoke or CO alarm goes off in your house.  I'd prefer it to hear high pitched sirens from anywhere in the house and alert me to look into it.(2) Unless your existing detectors are networked together so that when one sounds then all sound, you would have to have one of these listeners for every single smoke or CO detector that you want to be alerted for.(3) With monitoring, you have only one chance to avoid a false alarm for smoke, and none for CO.  I really want them to call my home and my emergency contacts first like they would do for a break-in sensed by the other alarm sensors.  For their response protocol, look up their topic "Getting a Call from Ring’s Professional Monitoring Center" that details their procedure.  As of this review, for smoke, they call your 1st contact with a chance to cancel, then emergency response, then your 2nd & 3rd contacts.  For CO they dispatch emergency response first, then your emergency contacts.(4) I really worry about false alarms for the smoke detector near the kitchen when something accidentally burns on the stove but is taken care of, yet the smoke detector goes off.  I have my 1st contact as my home phone so I have a reasonable chance to intercept, but it still worries me being my only chance.  My alternative is to put listeners only in places that aren't likely to have false alarms, which adds risk.(5) To test any of your existing smoke or CO detectors, you must either remove batteries from all your listeners or put them into test mode.  I think it will be easy to forget while testing them once in a while to make sure they still work.  Or someone else who doesn't know my Ring system could test it and not know.  CO test accident will trigger a false alarm.  So I worry a bit.(6) Although combined Smoke & CO detectors exist, if you look into it, their ideal locations are very different (where smoke gathers versus where CO gathers) and so you are more likely to have separate units, doubling your need for these.SUMMARY:Certainly better than having no monitoring, and gives me peace of mind.  I just think it could be more flexible, and have a high tolerance protocol to avoid false alarms.

reviewTitle: A little twitchy - makes me nervous
reviewDescription: I have First Alert interconnected smoke and CO detectors. I was told by Ring support that they would give me a call first if the fire alarm signal was detected, but they would immediately dispatch fire department if CO alarm is detected. False smoke alarms happen from time to time, so it is nice to know that I could cancel it. However, during test mode I noticed that it falsely detected a CO alarm when my talking detector shouts "EVACUATE!" (4 syllables -> 4 tones -> CO alarm). I had to spin the speaker of the alarm a little further away from the sensor until this stopped happening. This means that if I wasn't careful about placement, it could have immediately dispatched fire department on the first false smoke alarm. Also pressing the test button on any smoke alarm will trigger both fire alarm and CO alarm. If you're not careful about first putting the sensor in test mode, that could also cause a visit from the fire department. I feel a little nervous using this device. That's a shame because this detector was the main reason why I bought into the Ring system in the first place. All I really wanted was to be notified of issues if I am away from home.
